repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Paul R. Krause World War II Poems and Associated Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized in one series: World War II poems.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Robert W. Krause, son of Paul R. Krause, sent the poems to DCA in 2012.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fragile pages were sleeved in mylar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of evocative poems Paul R. Krause wrote while serving in the U.S. Army during World War II and the occupation of Germany. Also includes some background research material for poems, a brief biographical sketch and one photograph.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul R. Krause was born May 24 1926 on Staten Island, New York. He was a graduate of Staten Island's Curtis High School and after getting out of the army, he attended Pittsburgh State College in New York. He transferred to Tufts College where he graduated with a degree in English in 1950. During World War II he fought in the Battle of the Bulge in Germany and stayed as part of the U.S. Army occupation of Germany after the war because of his German language skills. He worked as writer and case worker for the New York City Welfare Department, his work and life always reflecting his concern for the poor. In his spare time he walked and biked through much of the world and took photographs. He died in Brooklyn at the age of 82 on February 19, 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series includes evocative poems about World War II and the occupation of Germany after the war. Topics include France, Germany, issues such as the daily life of infantry men (reserve, mud, entertainment, killing, the 'color problem,' injury). Poems are not dated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged alphabetically by title of poem; biographical sketch at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Paul Krause biographical sketch and photograph
